TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit Hold extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Represents specific properties of a hold.

remarks.para: Holds can be placed on documents to exempt them from the enforcement of the expiration policy that is applied to them. You can also use them to prevent the modification and deletion of documents. Holds are stored as list items on a specified list in the Records Center site. As such, you can manipulate many of the properties of a hold programmatically by accessing the object that represents that hold.

Docs.param: The web.
Docs.summary: Gets all of the applicable holds list accessible to the caller.
Docs.returns: All of the applicable holds lists that are accessible to the caller.

remarks.para: The applicable holds lists are the holds lists that satisfy the following conditions: 1.The caller has view rights on the holds lists. 2. The holds lists are present in the "web" or any parent web of "web" including the site collections root web.

MemberSignature.Value: public static void NominateEdiscoverySuscriptionHub (Microsoft.SharePoint.SPSite site);
.method public static hidebysig void NominateEdiscoverySuscriptionHub(class Microsoft.SharePoint.SPSite site) cil managed
Public Shared Sub NominateEdiscoverySuscriptionHub (site As SPSite)
public: static void NominateEdiscoverySuscriptionHub(Microsoft::SharePoint::SPSite ^ site);
static member NominateEdiscoverySuscriptionHub : Microsoft.SharePoint.SPSite -> unit

Docs.param: The site which is to be nominated as the hub
Docs.summary: Nominates the specified site as the eDiscovery hub of the site subscription.

remarks.para: This method does the following:1. Check that the site subscription actually exists.(without that you cannot nominate a hub). 2. Check if there is an existing hub (presumably which was nominated earlier.) 3. If there is an existing hub then we remove its nomination.4. Now in the Site Subscriptions Settings make and entry for the hub's site id. 5. On the Site's properties cache the fact that it is the hub.

Docs.exception: Site is a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic).
Site does not belong to a site subscription.
